reviews.review_msg: An erudite professor who exudes first-rate scholarly brilliance that has graced the halls of SFU over the last several decades with her sagacious academic preeminence, one of which will probably never be seen again. It is so depressing to see that this summer will be her last semester prior to her exalted retirement. A gem that'll be dearly missed

Boring slow lectures which just feel like rambling because she never has a complete thought. Group work where students come up with the exam questions. Very strict on citations but doesn't really care about content so marks are easy to earn.

She is good professor and willing to help students to get information they need for the project. And she also know some people's difficulties on speaking in front of many people that she would give us chance to use writing as participation.
Seemed pretty nice. But you do have to put a decent amount of work in to do well, she is a tough marker for papers and tutorial attendance + participation is really important to do well
She was really nice and class was always light.

Super tough marker who assigns an unusually a high amount of work for a sophomore level history course. Never expected a prof to be so persnickety about citations in every written homework assignment since I lost so many marks as a result of her deductions.

Professor Matsumura is an excellent and engaging professor, and really rewards students who engage with the material in lectures. She hasn't adapted super well to the partially online aspects of modern courses, but in person (and when you can get a hold of her online) she gives good feedback and is really good at explaining the course material.

I found the lectures to be fairly interesting and informative. Some may find her speaking style a bit dry but I didn't mind. There was a weekly tutorial which she led and expects a fair bit of participation in. Grading and feedback on projects felt a bit unclear at times. I found her to respond to emails fairly quickly if you have questions.

This course was way too much work for a 200 level course. I took this in my last semester of my undergrad and it was harder than my 400 level seminars. The exams expected way too much out of us in one sitting and she is absolutely crazy about citations. As an English student I've never had a prof dock so many marks for citations.

It's interesting if you want to learn the Japanese perspective of the Asia-Pacific War. The prof really pushes students to think differently and presents a lot of critical thinking and her own unique perspectives. There's a 35% essay, 25% participation, 10% presentation proposal & 25% presentation on the final exam period. Prepare well before!

She's a really great prof if a little intimidating. She's a really tough marker so prepare for that. For the term paper she put different topics up on Canvas with a few sources because she didn't want us doing all the research? It was kind of weird but she was really helpful. She's not great on giving feedback on papers but she gives some.

Professor Matsumura is great! I agree, you gotta work hard to earn a good grade but what do you expect, its a 300 level course. fair marker, very nice lady, and definitely knows her stuff. great class and would def. take again. Also she got us pizza on the last day of class!!! also shes pretty hilarious too

Ms. Matsumura is a really solid choice (maybe the only choice) for HIST206. Her lectures are clear and concise, and she does have a passion for what she's teaching. Grading on written assignments is a bit harsh, but never unfair. I'd say that passing the course is easy, but getting a good grade is not. Be prepared to read and work hard!
Seems scary at first but actually really cares about her students. I would've failed this class if I didn't have basic knowledge of Japanese history and geography.
Janice is the best! Her reading assignments are a bit dry at times but overall a very fair marker and a genuinely very kind person. Would definitely recommend a class with her.

You gotta love Janice! She's bitterly sarcastic in the best way, her dry sense of humour came in handy during WWII in Japan class. She really knows her stuff and seems to like teaching. If I was going to do a Masters she would be one of the two people I'd consider asking to be my supervisor. I really like her teaching style
Not the most engaging of speakers, but provides interesting material so as to keep your attention. Fair marker. I'd definitely take more classes with her.

Good prof overall. Matsumura may seem intimidating at first, but she's actually quite friendly to students. We had to only read 1 article and the textbook each week. Not hard. And not a lot of assignments either. Just one short paper and one long paper, and final. But she does expect you to work really hard to earn a good grade.
She is awesome! Just keep up with the weekly reading and actually start the paper soon.
Cool prof, picky with essay, must take!!
super nice

She makes this class way too hard for a second year course. Because of her vast knowledge of Japanese history she expects students to have a concise understanding of the course's topics. The class is not worth it when she is teaching. Tutorials are completely pointless but mandatory.

Janice might come off as a little scary (when she's talking about the papers she's just graded) at first.  And yes, she does stand at the front and read off a paper.  She does this because she's well prepared and has the information well-organized.  She's got a wonderfully dry sense of humour.  I highly recommend any of her classes.

Worst lecturer I have ever had - reads off a paper. knows the subject well, but doesn't make it interesting. rude and disinterested in teaching at all, it seems.  the tutorials were a bit better, she chose interesting readings, but it was a waste of time being in her class. i could have just read the book and taken more away...

The only good thing about her teaching is that she seems to know a great deal about her subject. Other than that, she is monotonous and is never prepared. Make sure you know the geography of your region first because she doesn't provide maps!
Love her dry sense of humour! Follow her advice on your paper proposals and you will be fine, fair marker and really helpful if you go see her in office hours
She is interested in what she teaches and communicates in a clear manner. But the tutorials do not have enough class participation and she does not bother to learn students names
She needs to lighten up on the grading. This is only a 2nd year class. Though see does know her stuff, she does not seem very interested in the subject matter. Her tutorials are useless.

This professor was really good.I recommend her to any students majoring in history.She is not an easy marker but she was very fair and comments were helpful.She was interested in the material and was very informative.For paper proposals:take he advice and you will do great!In some classes u read things & never discuss them,not in this class.
Ugh, monotone snoozefest...She was never on time and let us slip three lectures behind....ugh

I'd take Janice again for sure. She's picky about bibliography stuff, WAY more than other profs but that's my only complaint. Good tutorials, easy to talk to about papers. Hard marker but not at all unfair. One of the best I've had at SFU.

Utterly failed to motivate me. Her lectures and tuturials were dry, she merely read from a pre-written lecture that she has no doubt used many, many times. Wanted a full paper proposal early in the term, far before we had even learned enough course content to even think about topics. Sarcastic - sometimes amusing, other times at students' expense.
A good class.
Janice is fabulous.  I wish all my profs were so dedicated!

Her expectations are unclear, her lectures tend to go into minute detail on only a few issues, and while her sarcasm is at times humourous, it is sometimes at the student's expense. Very helpful, but prefers to push you in the direction *she* wants you to go, rather than helping you with your own. Overall, unless you love Japanese history - avoid.

At first her gruffness frightened me a little, but she's super nice if you go talk to her. LOVED her sarcastic & witty little remarks in lecture. Very organized. Loved how she wasn't biased in her teaching. Fair marker. Lots of info, definitely learned things in her class. Overall, I'd take her again in a heartbeat!

Janice is great, I'd recommend her to anyone. She is funny, while at the same time able to get lots of info across. She's also really easy to talk to about term paper's, exams etc. Tough marker, but not unfair.

Sometimes Janice is sometimes unclear about what she wants. She is incredibly cordial and loves what she does. But, at the same time, i probrably wouldn't recommend her compared to a lot of the profs that i have taken at burnaby.

How can anyone not like Janice? You have to love her for the great sarcastic remarks she adds in her lectures to make class interesting. I loved her balanced view about what seems to be some of the most contested and emotionally charged historical issues in the world. She is AWESOME!

She's a bit frightening at first but really nice once you talk to her. Sarcastic. Fast talker. Fair Marker. Takes attendance in tutorials. Overall, I'd recommend her & would take a class with her again. Not too hard, but not the easiest class I've taken either. Essay topics were difficult b/c they were very limited in choice.
I love Janice! My favourite prof ever! She bought the class 2 rounds of drinks and snacks at the end of the year. Come on people, Godzilla? LUV her!

Fantastic Proff. Really easy tests, and a hard marker on essays, but fair, and clear about requirements. Lots of knowledge about what she's teaching and a great sense of humour. Never before has a proff guffawed at mentioning "seppuku". Does she teach other Japanese history courses?

lots of reading, notes, and tutorial participation but extreamly good prof..just keep in mind there is no midterm and the final is easy so don't do all the reading taking pages of notes is a waste and tutorial readings are theoretical not fact bases so just use your noodle...great prof !
Great Class, large amount of detail... but interesting! Very sarcastic teacher... but is very helpful on the essays, but can scare you before she hands an essay back, even if you know you did well.

She marks essays really hard! then she explains how u can't write! She gives u another chance on the second essay to improve your grade but she marks even harder!She is really sarcastic too! Be prepared to write notes without thinking. She doesn't provide any sort of overhead, and speaks fast!
Seems to hate her job more than any other prof.  Depressingly entertaining.  You learn a little, and don't complain 'cause she marks easy.  Yay!

very very dry sense of humour. However, the course material is interesting, and she teaches it well. The Tutorials are mandatory (due to participation marks) The essays are marked harshly, and she tells students that they need to learn how to write. Her laugh is a bit scary.
Very easy tests!

Her dry sense of humor is odd and she really DOES look like a Japanese Indiana Jones!! But everything aside she is a great history prof and interested in learning from her students. Highly reccomended- from a 3.77 student

got weird and unusual satisfaction from watching her strut in every morning without taking one glance at the class, with her backpack swung over one shoulder, and most importantly the notorious and contently smug grin....GREAT PROF!
Really enjoyed this class on Japanese Women's History in 2001!  I would take this course again if I could.
Well.. what can I say? Material covered in lecture was very interesting. The class was fun and you learn lots, but essays are marked harshly! Hard marker no doubt!

Hehe, she is brash. But I liked her a lot, I think she is the most interesting prof. I've ever had, like a little female japanese Indiana Jones or something. She knows her Japanese history amazingly well, she likes Kuroawa, she's cool.
Lectures are relevant and essays are easy as long as you have read the course readings

While she seems distant in class, if spoken to in a one on one setting she is friendly and helpful. She certainly wants you to conform to her writing style for the essays. Makes it a bit hard at times, but if you think you can do this take her classes.

Tells students that they should seriously seek help in learning how to write.  I think she seriously needs to learn how to teach first.  A bitter, sarcastic woman.  Hated me even before I stepped in to her classroom
I was in all of her courses.. Awesome prof!!!!
A bit strict on the rules in regards to assignment deadlines, but very easy going.  Accepts other student's opinions very readily.  Feels like a friend more than a prof.
Great Prof, very interesting and informative but the final was a bit harder than expected.

V. approachable but marks hard on papers.  Great personality.  Not clear on what makes a good paper.  Quizzes were easy if you read her lecture notes.  Go to tutorial and just say something it is free marks.
Doesn't seem to care for teaching much.  Quite rude to the class.
Enjoyed the class a lot, marked the final extremely easy, made the material very interesting.
Easy to understand lectures and fair marker
she is a fair marker on assignments, but she marks hard for the test and her test was not as easy as she said it was going to be.
Very Easy; Looks too much like a man; Cool Prof
hehehehe.. she was monotone, but fun... :) playful at times...
if you go to class...and go to tutorials...you'll be fine...prof is cool
